thread.title: Ritchie Yorke, Brisbane music writer, dies at 73 | The Courier-Mail
thread.title_full: Ritchie Yorke, Brisbane music writer, dies at 73 | The Courier-Mail

title: Ritchie Yorke, Brisbane music writer, dies at 73 | The Courier-Mail
text:
Ritchie Yorke, Brisbane music writer, dies at 73 The Courier-Mail Yorke’s Lennon link 
QUEENSLAND music journalist Ritchie Yorke has died at the age of 73. 
He died last night at Brisbane’s The Prince Charles Hospital from complications of chronic obstructive pulmonary disease. 
Yorke’s career included 20 years as the chief music writer for The Sunday Mail . 
He was also a well-known figure in Canada, writing and editing for Rolling Stone , Billboard and The Globe and Mail . 
He made many friends and contacts along the way, notably joining the peace train with John Lennon in the 1960s. media_camera Ritchie Yorke in 1970. 
His book Christ You Know It Ain’t Easy: John and Yoko’s Battle For Peace came out last year. 
He also wrote Led Zeppelin: The Definitive Biography , with Robert Plant calling him “one of us”. 
Yorke began his music odyssey writing for the Northern News and TV Week in Brisbane in the early 1960s. He returned to Brisbane in his later years as the voice of music for The Sunday Mail until 2007. His wife Minnie Yorke said tributes and well wishes had flooded in from around the world. He is survived by four children and six grandchildren. Rather than a funeral, the family would be organising a celebration to be held at the Old Museum in Brisbane at a date yet to be announced. media_camera Yorke (left) with John Lennon and Yoko Ono at the Montreal Bed In For Peace in May 1969.
